title: How to Use Google to Search Within a Specific Website

steps.title: Open Google.
steps.content: Open Google. Go to https://www.google.com/ in your preferred web browser.

steps.title: Click the search bar.
steps.content: Click the search bar. It's in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Indicate that you want to search a specific site.
steps.content: Indicate that you want to search a specific site. Type site: into the search bar. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Type in your site's address without the "www" part.
steps.content: Type in your site's address without the "www" part. This should go immediately after the site: tag with no space in between. For example: to search Facebook, you would type site:facebook.com .

steps.title: Press the spacebar.
steps.content: Press the spacebar. Doing so places a space between your website's address and what you'll type next.

steps.title: Enter a search term or phrase.
steps.content: Enter a search term or phrase. [2] X Research source This should be whatever you want to search for within the site. For example: to search Facebook for "puppies for sale", your whole search phrase would read site:facebook.com puppies for sale .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . Doing so will run your search; when the search results page loads, you should see only results for items that both match your search and are on the website you specified.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Click or double-click the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Click the address bar.
steps.content: Click the address bar. It's the text box at the top of the browser window. If there's any text in the address bar, remove it before proceeding.

steps.title: Type in a website's address.
steps.content: Type in a website's address. This should be the address on which you want to search. Make sure you include the website's "www" section here. For example, to search Facebook, you would type in www.facebook.com .

steps.title: Look the "Press Tab to search" message.
steps.content: Look the "Press Tab to search" message. In the far-right side of the address bar, you should see a message encouraging you to press the Tab ↹ key to search your site. If you don't see this message, you can't search the site from within the Google Chrome address bar. You can still use Google to search within a site .

steps.title: Press the Tab ↹ key.
steps.content: Press the Tab ↹ key. If you see the "Press Tab to search" message, pressing the Tab ↹ key will open a search bar in which to search your specified website.

steps.title: Type in your search term or phrase.
steps.content: Type in your search term or phrase. This should be whatever you want to search the website for.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . Doing so will open the search for your term or phrase within the specified website, at which point you can review the search results as needed.
